n90HO3KCFGZUYOYEt2pVqw.text: For 1.50 you can pick up from here what are probably the best chips in town and I'm sure that if a certain well know larger company did chips, they'd probably do chips like these.  It's positioning at first seems perhaps not that ideal, but Grassmarket is 5 minutes away and Lava Ignite is even closer so it's well worth considering adding it to your root home.  They do more than just chips, however, and you can pick from a good range of items, but quite frankly I always go for what they do best.

photos.caption: Photo of Kingfisher - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

yzq1p3OvBXGrsfzrfRnZ6g.text: BURNT!!!  For the people who love burnt, greasy and cold food this is best place to come but be aware you will be waiting roughly about three house before youre food even arrives.   Surprised this place hasn't been shut down from the health and safety food industry yet.

rHd7kwf29qsPa0u3q4An4A.text: Sure this place is cheap, but you get what you pay for...I have been here twice...the pizza is so greasy and soggy...the staff are sort of awkward, nice, but a bit creepy and I felt a smidgen uncomfortable. The second time I got a doner kebab and this was the worst doner that I have ever had. The meat was overcooked and flavourless...the slices were far to big, the vegetable and sauce selection was limited to cabbage, lettuce, onions, and mayo and hot sauce...these vegetables weren't fresh...Why are you selling doner, if your not going to put the effort in to make it authentic or at least add some more veg selection and almost like the cherry on top...there is a 50p charge for card payment. They do however have a twenty percent student discount.

imd32MWxGlYa4DDqBRR3_A.text: Not so good chicken was not good had odd spice and was cooked in the pizza oven not even grilled. Pizza I shouldn't comment since I live in NY it just wouldn't be fair. Mince pie was stone cold  but the pita was good

Jdfw8d_QzJFZy6eZRfM8JA.text: I ordered the chicken kebab from here with all the toppings.  It wasn't cheap and the chicken was terrible (no flavour, weird rubbery texture).  It was for take away and I threw the kebab away half way through eating it was so bad.  The kebab came out quick but I'd prefer to wait for freshly cooked chicken.  Go to samsuns or trek over to kebab mahal for a good kebab.
